results.title: Tale of one city
results.creator_credit: Zoran Janjic, Peter Johnson, Department of Housing, Environment and Community Development and Film Australia
results.brief_description: This film uses animation in a light-hearted manner to show some of the problems of living in a modern city, the need for more careful urban planning to help alleviate these problems, and the way in which pressure groups have an important influence on the town planners.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Zoran Janjic, Peter Johnson, Department of Housing, Environment and Community Development and Film Australia

results.title: Sustainable Ouyen
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Several years ago a group of Ouyen Primary School students petitioned their local council to adopt a community-recycling program. To everybody’s surprise the council not only provided an unprecedented household recycling service but did so at a loss. Since that time the community has launched a number of forward thinking initiatives with solar power, sustainable agriculture and improved water usage. Whether it’s the Ouyen Football Club, High School or local farmers, there’s an understanding that sustainable practices must be employed now in order for future Ouyen generations to benefit.

results.creator_credit: Deborah Horne, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Family treasures
results.creator_credit: Penny Morison, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Penny Morison provides a sensorial experience as she recalls her many holidays spent at the family holiday home in Aireys Inlet, on the south-west coast of Victoria. Run by her aunt, the holiday home has provided countless Summer memories for Penny as she was growing up and for future generations.

results.title: Japan: The Island Empire
results.creator_credit: Maureen Zrike, Christopher Zrike and International Video Network
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Japan begins to unfold as you enter a Zen temple, then witness an ancient ritual in a Shinto shrine. In the resort of Ibusuki, you will marvel at guests buried to the neck in steaming volcanic sand. Admire the great Buddha of Kamakura and the splendid architecture of 400 year old Himeji Castle. Then plunge into the frantic pace of Tokyo during the Sanja Matsuri Festival.

results.title: Taking chances
results.creator_credit: David Taft, Ann Darrouzet, Film Victoria, Australian Bicentennial Authority, Community Services Victoria and Janina Craig Screen Services
results.brief_description: Discusses recreation and leisure options for intellectually disabled poeple and the benefits to organisers, participants and parents. Profiles intellectually disabled people participating in an aquabuddy program, competitive darts, basketball, radio broadcasting and gardening. Emphasises a focus on ability rather than disability.

results.title: Roma
results.creator_credit: Barbara Lemon, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Barbara Lemon pays tribute to her grandmother; cheeky, fiesty, caring and resilient. From growing up in Warrigal during the war to the birth of her great grandchildren, Roma has seen a lot in her 102 years and is more than happy to share her stories with her family.

results.title: Eternal France
results.creator_credit: August von Kageneck, James R. Conner and Kageneck Video
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
From the Roman ruins in Provence to Napoleon’s Arc de Triomphe in Paris, the rich history and culture of France awaits you. Wander inside the majestic Cathedrals of Reims and Chartres. Watch the artistry of glass-makers in Baccarat, the lacemakers in the Auvergne and silk painters in Lyon. Then, marvel at the beauty and mystery of Brittany’s stunning abbey of Mont-Saint-Michel.
results.creator_credit_for_label: August von Kageneck, James R. Conner and Kageneck Video

results.title: Young Philly
results.creator_credit: Matt Blackwood, Csilla Csongvay, David Withers and ACMI
results.brief_description: Phillip is a 20-year-old Hip Hop artist from Mildura who won the prestigious Noel Tovey Achievement Award in 2010 (for Emerging Artist). Despite having a difficult start in life, Phil is intent on living a positive life and breaking the negative stereotypes associated with young Aboriginal people. He shares his passion for rapping with a desire to become a youth worker in the hopes of one day establishing a youth centre for Indigenous kids in Mildura.

results.title: Expectations
results.creator_credit: Jimmy Pasakos, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: In this initimate use of the form of Digital Storytelling, Jim Pasakos puts together this story for his child. Using second person narrative, Pasakos tells of the decision to have a baby and the processes leading up to the birth. This serves as a very personal account of childbirth and a cherished family record.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jimmy Pasakos, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
